page.title: 01Introduction
page.content: This area is a level plateau about 61m above ses level.It is cut across by a number of brooks including the Westmeadow Brook and the Grace Dieu Brook. It is an area of intensively farmed land with the principal crops being wheat,barley and oilseed rape.In the south west corner of the rectangle isa small farm growing soft fruits which the public pick themselves an pay for what they pick.It is called a self pick farm. There is very little residential land in the rectangle.A small piece of the villag of Belton is in the south west corner and part of Long Whatton is in the north east corner.However most of Long Whatton with the amenities is in another rectangle.
